image.altText: Adam Reilly - man with white shirt and Indigenous artwork tie looks ahead

props.synopsis: Adam Reilly has told a parliamentary inquiry it was not his decision to leave the Department for Child Protection and has called for changes to the system.

title.children: 'Hurtful rumours': Former SA child protection chief explains departure

image.altText: A metal sign on a building saying YOUTH COURT

props.synopsis: A teenage girl who had items of extremist material on her phone and school-issued laptop is just a "young, naive, Muslim girl with autism", a court has heard.

title.children: Muslim girl 'with autism' pleads guilty to possessing extremist material

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas announcing a cabinet reshuffle.

props.synopsis: A new artificial intelligence portfolio and changes to the Child Protection Minister's responsibilities have been revealed in a reshuffle of the Malinauskas government cabinet.

title.children: AI, autism and child protection in focus for Malinauskas cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: Dozens of bricks of drugs wrapped and laid out on a blue tarp

props.synopsis: Two young Victorian men who were involved in the attempted importation of more than 100 kilograms of cocaine into South Australia have been sentenced to three years in jail with a non-parole period of 18 months.

title.children: Pair labelled 'muppets' jailed over attempted 'astronomical' cocaine import

image.altText: Steve Alderson photo

props.synopsis: Golfer Steven Alderson made international headlines when he became the first winner with autism on the Golf for the Disabled Tour. He hopes to use his success to inspire others living with autism to chase their dreams.

title.children: Bullied golf champion Steve Alderson hopes to become a beacon for others living with autism

image.altText: Man with head torch stands over a large flower

props.synopsis: Hand-pollination of the pungent corpse flower results in hundreds of seeds that will be sent across the world to help preserve the endangered species.

title.children: Adelaide corpse flowers spread endangered stench worldwide

image.altText: Dr Megan Brooks - woman with black jacket and blue shirt and short hair walks out of coroners court

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard that multiple attempts to escalate an emergency response were made after a ramping-related death in Adelaide, but staff were told the situation did not meet the criteria.

title.children: Hospital boss's attempt to escalate emergency response after ramping-related death denied, court hears

image.altText: A group including members of the National Socialist Network.

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi leader refuses to sign his bail forms while 14 men were granted bail after their involvement in a far-right rally on the weekend.

title.children: Neo-Nazi refuses to sign bail forms as 14 others from Australia Day rally released

image.altText: A stethoscope on a white surface

props.synopsis: South Australian general practitioner Hemant Kumar Vanmali began an inappropriate relationship with a patient, who was aged in her 80s, "almost immediately" after her last consultation.

title.children: Doctor suspended over inappropriate relationship with elderly patient

image.altText: Shark carcass lies on the sand along the beach

props.synopsis: Research confirms a great white shark that washed up on a beach in south-west Victoria was the victim of killer whale predation.

title.children: Bite mark swabs show orcas killed 4.7m great white shark

image.altText: The tail of a Virgin Australia plane on the tarmac, with other planes lines up behind it.

props.synopsis: Virgin has confirmed it will "indefinitely suspend" its Darwin to Adelaide service, saying it will add more direct flights between the Top End and other capital cities.

title.children: 'Unbelievable': Virgin suspends flights between Darwin and Adelaide

image.altText: An aerial photo of fire damage near Nhill

props.synopsis: Katelynn Clark felt certain her home would burn to the ground when a raging bushfire hit the edge of her rural property on Monday night.

title.children: Authorities warn against complacency as western Victoria bushfires grow

image.altText: Big black cockie with white marking on tail, perched on gum tree branch, holding a feather

props.synopsis: The deadly Wangary bushfire 20 years ago appears to have been the final nail in the coffin for yellow-tailed black cockatoos in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula. Ecologists are calling for urgent action before it's too late.

title.children: Help needed to save the last cockatoos restricted to this region

image.altText: Dan Cregan speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police Minister Dan Cregan is quitting state cabinet, citing "pressing family matters", triggering a reshuffle ahead of his retirement from politics at the next election.

title.children: SA minister quits cabinet ahead of retirement from politics

image.altText: Asian-looking smiling man, light suit, and woman, short hair, dark suit, tie, earrings, sit in front of  haystack, arm in arm.

props.synopsis: Julie Mar says she has sometimes gone without buying groceries to fund her husband's partner visa. A solicitor says the application process can cost upwards of $9,000.

title.children: Partner visa expense and delay cause heartache for married couple

image.altText: aerial shot of Adelaide's water desalination plant

props.synopsis: Desalination production south of Adelaide is set to quadruple as local reservoirs fall to 44 per cent capacity, with dry conditions causing the lowest inflows in over 40 years.

title.children: Desalination plant to 'ramp up' as reservoir levels drop to 20-year low

image.altText: Steve Smith raises his bat and cap after scoring century

props.synopsis: Steve Smith joined Usman Khawaja in scoring a century on the opening day of the first Test as Australia dominates Sri Lanka in Galle.

title.children: Steve Smith, Usman Khawaja combine for twin centuries on day one of first Test

image.altText: Steve Smith walkiing off the cricket ground, raising his bat to the crowd, acknowledging their applause

props.synopsis: Steve Smith has achieved one of cricket's great feats, scoring 10,000 Test runs in a career.

title.children: Steve Smith adds to legendary career with 10,000 Test runs milestone

image.altText: Dutton Alice Springs 1

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has committed "in principle" to supporting the NT government's seven point plan to reduce crime in Alice Springs, if the Coalition win government in this year's federal election.

title.children: Dutton commits 'in principle' to Alice Springs crime plan

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to the media

props.synopsis: Wednesday's inflation outcome may well turn out to be the Albanese government's first genuine political break in well over a year. We'll know for sure when the Reserve Bank meets next month.

title.children: The fight against inflation has defined Labor's term. Now they've got a break

image.altText: An older woman with short white hair exercising with a pair of pale blue dumbbells.

props.synopsis: An online program aimed at improving diet, exercise and other modifiable risk factors for dementia has resulted in better cognition in older adults, Australian research has found.

title.children: Major Australian study finds lifestyle changes can delay cognitive decline

image.altText: A female teacher with red hair leans down to the desk of a primary-school student to help her with a question in class.

props.synopsis: Experts warn Australia's education system is "failing to deliver" for half a million kids and putting their future wellbeing at risk, but lessons from 2024 offer hope.

title.children: As Australian students underperform, one group is bucking the trend

image.altText: Caroline Kennedy press club

props.synopsis: Caroline Kennedy, the former US ambassador to Australia, has urged US senators to reject her cousin's bid to become health secretary.

title.children: Caroline Kennedy calls RFK Jr a predator ahead of confirmation hearing

image.altText: Whisky barrels in a row in the Nant distillery.

props.synopsis: After a criminal investigation was announced almost eight years ago, the man allegedly behind the Nant whisky investment scandal has faced court for the first time.

title.children: Man allegedly behind whisky investment scandal facing 736 charges

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell holding the ball, bending forward, taking a deep breath

props.synopsis: The NRL rules both Latrell Mitchell and new Parramatta signing Josh Addo-Carr can use the All Stars clash towards their respective suspensions.

title.children: Mitchell and Addo-Carr to use All Stars match towards suspensions

image.altText: Graffiti on the front of a window

props.synopsis: The graffiti was brandished in black spray paint across the Summer Hill MP's office in Marrickville on Wednesday morning.

title.children: Man charged after minister's Sydney office damaged with graffiti twice

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A graphic showing two warships next to each other. One is smaller.

props.synopsis: Tokyo is stepping up its campaign to win a lucrative Australian naval contract by pledging to give "priority" to warship exports over its own navy.

title.children: Japan vows to prioritise Australia over its own navy with new warships

image.altText: Kyiv missile

props.synopsis: The US president says he has good relationships with Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin, but analysts say negotiating an end to the conflict is going to take much more than that.

title.children: 'Got a lot more leverage over Putin': Trump's path to end Ukraine war

image.altText: Sign in a florist saying "dear customer, cash only, no internet"

props.synopsis: For some brands, surviving PR disasters means facing a public backlash and trying to rebuild trust — a nearly impossible task once it's lost.

title.children: The recovery from PR blunders can be slow and costly

image.altText: Two men sitting on a table speaking.

props.synopsis: Liang Wenfeng is now leading China in its AI revolution as the superpower attempts to keep pace with the dominant AI industry in the United States. But who is the founder of DeepSeek?

title.children: Who is Liang Wenfeng, the founder of AI company DeepSeek?

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron gestures with his hands while standing in front of the Mona Lisa.

props.synopsis: Patrons at the world's most visited museum will be able to separately access its most famous work of art, Leonardo Da Vinci's Mona Lisa, following a six-year renovation announced by French President Emmanuel Macron.

title.children: Changes at Louvre to provide separate access to Mona Lisa

image.altText: A suited arm points to a large sign with a clock at 11.58 and 'It is 2 minutes to Midnight' on it.

props.synopsis: The Doomsday Clock has been reset by scientists to 89 seconds to midnight - closer than ever before to global catastrophe

title.children: Doomsday Clock closer to midnight amid AI emergence and Russian nuclear threat

image.altText: Hussein Chamas in cuffs on the floor of a boat, police behind him

props.synopsis: Federal police allege Hussein Chamas was arrested on a yacht off the Northern Territory coast that was headed towards Indonesia.

title.children: Fugitive allegedly boarded yacht off NT coast trying to flee country

image.altText: A black and white photo of a woman sitting at a table with a book open, looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A controversial memoir of a Finnish woman who migrated to Stalin’s Soviet Russia in the 1930s and escaped in 1941. Ninety years later, her granddaughter has translated the diary into English.

title.children: Controversial diary became one of Finland's most banned books
